location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Jodhpore [Jodhpur] to Colonel John Allen Wright

mods.abstract: Letter advising Wright not to interfere in the affair of the Sherishtadar other than to give advice to the Maharana.The letter goes on to request that Mr Bickajee carry out his settlement work and detailing plans to settle most of the disputed borders of the states.The letter also suggests where Mr Yate should begin his settlement work on arrival and advising carefulness in collecting information on the Dussooree [DƒÅsori] Pass Border before reporting to Colonel Wright and Major Walter unless the dispute cannot be disposed of in which case all papers should be sent to Pelly for a final decision.
